item.title: NHL 26 Release Date And Platforms Announced

EA Sports has announced the release date and platforms for NHL 26.

As part of the game‚Äôs full reveal on Wednesday (August 6), it was announced that NHL 26 will release on September 12 for the Standard Edition. Those who buy the Deluxe Edition of the game will get it 7 days earlier on September 5.

The September release date marks the first time since 2019‚Äôs NHL 20 that the game is releasing in September. The last five games have all launched in October.

More NHL: NHL 26 Cover Athlete Announced

In addition to the release date, it was confirmed that the game will launch on PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S. Those hoping for a PC or Nintendo Switch 2 release will have to wait at least one more year.

Other features of NHL 26 include a revamped Be-A-Pro mode, ICE-Q 2.0 gameplay, and new HUT seasons. There was no mention to changes to the game‚Äôs franchise mode.

item.title: All Gears of War: Ultimate Edition & Gears of War: Reloaded Differences Explained
item.content:encoded:
Gears of War: Reloaded brings the OG Gears game into 2025. But it‚Äôs not to be confused with Gears of War: Ultimate Edition, and the differences between the two releases are very different.

From the outside, Gears of War‚Äôs Ultimate Edition and Reloaded are very similar. They‚Äôre both updated versions of the 2006 classic. There‚Äôs a 10-year difference between the two releases. But you‚Äôre probably wondering to yourself: What‚Äôs included in Gears of War: Reloaded that can‚Äôt be found in the Ultimate Edition?

It‚Äôs a good question. I‚Äôve already answered another burning query: ‚ÄúWhich games does Gears of War: Reloaded include? So let‚Äôs now run through each version and what to expect.

Every Gears of War: Ultimate Edition & Gears of War: Reloaded Difference

Crossplay & Cross-Progression

Gears of War: Reloaded has both crossplay and cross-progression. The Ultimate Edition was released before these trends became commonplace. This means if you own Reloaded, you can do co-op campaign outings and play online multiplayer with players across PlayStation, Xbox, and PC.

Plus, your save data can be transferred across all applicable platforms for an easy way to make progress on any format.

PlayStation Debut

Hell froze over the day Reloaded was announced. Xbox and PC players getting to play it wasn‚Äôt a surprise, but a Gears title coming to PS5? It‚Äôs a sign of the times and how the era of exclusives and first-party media is coming to an end.

Reloaded is coming out on PS5 the same day as Xbox and PC‚ÄîAugust 26. Again, crossplay is a great asset for speedier matchmaking and great interconnectivity. The Ultimate Edition can‚Äôt be purchased on PlayStation, but Reloaded sure can.

Reloaded is a Remake, Not a Remaster

The two words are fairly interchangeable, but there is a big difference between the two. A remaster is the same content but with shinier visuals, whereas a remake upgrades the visuals, but also includes new features and might make the odd tweak to a map, gun, or sometimes even the story.

From what I understand, the narrative is unchanged‚Äîwhich is good for those seeking purity. But expect subtle differences here and there.

Updated Graphics

The Ultimate Edition was released in 2015 and boasted 1080p / Full HD / 30 FPS for the campaign and 60 FPS for multiplayer. This was impressive at the time, but it seems cute now.

Gears of War: Reloaded comes locked and loaded with 4K, HDR, VRR, and 120 FPS. The difference in graphical fidelity is massive and a serious upgrade, even if you played the Ultimate Edition.

Should You Play Gears of War: Reloaded if You Own Gears of War: Ultimate Edition?

If you love the first GOW game, I‚Äôd still recommend playing Gears of War: Reloaded if you‚Äôve purchased the Ultimate Edition before.

I‚Äôm the kind of person who buys remasters of remasters‚Äîdon‚Äôt judge me. If I love a game enough, I find new excuses to play it again. Reloaded‚Äôs content is mostly the same as the Ultimate Edition. It has all the fun DLC included, too.

The major improvement Ultimate Edition owners will experience is the graphics and performance. I think these are reasons enough to play Reloaded.

Notice how I‚Äôve said ‚Äúplay‚Äù instead of ‚Äúbuy‚Äù throughout this guide? This is because if you‚Äôve owned the Ultimate Edition before, you might be entitled to a free Gears of War: Reloaded upgrade.

I hope I‚Äôve cleared up the key differences between Gears of War: Ultimate Edition and Reloaded. If you know of any more, let me know through the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Portal Mode Will Keep The Game Fresh Years After Release
item.content:encoded:
Battlefield 6‚Äôs Portal mode has been designed to make the game feel fresh ‚Äúyears after you first picked it up‚Äù.

Earlier this year, it was revealed that Battlefield Portal was returning to the main series this year, and we finally got a confirmation during BF6‚Äôs multiplayer reveal. The new Portal mode puts the tools for creating in the hands of players, allowing them to craft custom and unique experiences. Now, developers have revealed the philosophy behind the Portal mode.

Battlefield 6‚Äôs Portal Mode is For Players That Want to Do More than Completing a Game

During an interview with VideoGamer, UX director Alan Pimm revealed some new insights for BF6‚Äôs Portal mode. Pimm first spoke about how the developers are looking to improve the Portal from 2042. The mode had several ‚Äúclever tools,‚Äù such as scripting your own AI, customising the mode to your preferences, and more. They realised that people want terrain options, where they can pick different bits and not just their modes, and also manipulate and play with them.

Pimm goes on to say that the new Battlefield 6 Portal creations can be certified as modes in their own right, such as a ‚Äúlocked weapons mode‚Äù. However, if players try to make an XP farm for themselves, they will be told, ‚ÄúActually, you won‚Äôt get XP from this one‚Äù, along with other warnings in the Editor.

Pimm elaborates that players don‚Äôt want a game they can complete, they want to grow with it, evolve with it or ‚Äúmake their dreams come true‚Äù. Battlefield 6‚Äôs Portal mode was designed with one philosophy in mind: longevity. The developers want to make the game feel fresh, ‚Äúyears after you first picked it up‚Äù.

Pimm concluded, stating that some players play for only an hour, while others play for 8 hours straight. These tools will cater to all types of players, ‚Äúlisten to the whole community, and make it accessible to do as much as possible.‚Äù

In other news, Battlefield 6 game servers are already full with over 40,000 players waiting for the beta to start. Additionally, a designer has stated that sniper glint nerfs are on the way.
